doc.title: Harmony Gold
doc.source_uri: 25.9月 普通个人版/9.1 普通个人版/BofA/FY25 Results Guidance miss on production and cost capex increasing Reiterate Rating NEUTRAL PO 250.00 ZAR Price 233.00 Z_2025-08-28

passages.text: Reiterate Rating: NEUTRAL | PO: 250.00 ZAR | Price: 233.00 ZAR

Harmony (HAR) reported FY25 headline earnings of R14,531, \(+27\%\) yoy, \(- 2\%\) vs BofAe and \(- 21\%\) vs Visible Alpha (VA) consensus. FY25 DPS of 3.82 Rp/share was \(- 17\%\) below consensus, \(- 9\%\) below BofAe. FY26 production guidance for 1.4- 1.5Moz was soft versus consensus (- 3% at mid- point), and AISC guidance came in \(+12\%\) ahead of consensus at mid- point, suggesting lower- than- expected FCF generation over the next 12 months. Eva Copper FID is 'imminent'. Model update: We update for FY26 guidance, which has a \(- 18 / - 12\%\) impact on our FY26/27 headline earnings. We reiterate our Neutral rating with a new PO of R250 (from R290), based on 1.35x P/NPV, after updating for FY26 and guidance. While we like HAR's gold price leverage (BofA Global Research is constructive on gold, calling it to hit US \(4,000 / oz\) in 2H25), we remain cautious on growth execution risk (Eva Copper, MAC Copper).

Production guidance of 1.4- 1.5Moz came in below consensus and our estimates. Mponeng will produce more than we expected and the rest of the portfolio less \(=\) growing dependence on Mponeng's temporarily high grades. High grades are unlikely to be planned 'high grading' (rigid mine front due to seismicity) and were always part of the plan (currently working on 2 half levels in high grade payshoot). HAR maintains that reserve grades are appropriate, which means moderation from 9.65 g/t in FY26 back down to c. \(8.9g / t\) at some stage - exact timing is unknown. Moderation back to reserve represents a c. \(1 - 2\%\) group level production headwind, or c. - 22koz per annum.

HAR is prioritising capex in high grade assets (Moab, Mponeng, Hidden Valley). FY26 capex guidance was increased c. R2.6bn, R1bn from higher Hidden Valley capex, R0.8bn higher growth spend. 'Core' assets are currently highly cash generative, but we also like the low- cost, higher- return (but smaller- scale) surface retreatment opportunities. On our numbers, HAR could exploit c. 7Moz of additional surface retreatment reserves. Given HAR's focus on high grade underground, we think the market could be underappreciating this option. See our recent deep- dive report: Windfall cash flows, Capital allocation in focus.

Gold & Precious Metals

HAR's operations in South Africa include underground mines, one open- pit mine & tailings retreatment ops. In Papua New Guinea, HAR's interests include Hidden Valley, an open- pit gold / silver mine and a \(50\%\) stake in the Wafilgolp project (Newmont HAR's partner). The company has also acquired the Eva copper mine project in Australia.

Harmony is a high- cost / low- margin gold producer given that the majority of its production comes from deep, labour- intensive South African underground mines. We are bullish gold and forecast gold prices to reach \$4,000/oz within the year. However, while Harmony gives leverage to moves in the gold price, we would expect some investors to be cautious on Harmony's relatively worse (albeit improving) safety record than industry peers.
Shares / ADR 1.00 Price to Book Value 3.0x
Key Changes(US$)PreviousCurrentPrice Obj.16.1813.952025E EPS1.321.292026E EPS2.892.362027E EPS3.052.692025E DPS0.240.18
Exhibit 1: Lower earnings from lower production, higher AISC Changes to estimates
Exhibit 1: Lower earnings from lower production, higher AISC Changes to estimates

- MAC integration: MAC will go through operational and technical review in the first quarter of ownership. With February 2026 results, management will provide the outlook for 2H MAC copper production, integration plan. The mine is ventilation constrained, with some flexibility constraints that MAC is working on. HAR will take its own approach once in the mine. Mill, vent, winder upgrades were all made by the previous owner, so the condition of the mine is good despite being old.

- Hidden Valley capex will remain elevated in FY26 due to fleet replacement, Stage 8 cutback and tailings storage facility (TSF) expansion (extends life of mine by 18 months to 2030). This makes up c. R1bn of the c. R2.6bn surprise in FY26 capex. Some of this will have been capex budget not utilised fully in FY25. The Hidden Valley life extension beyond 2030 would require further study.

BofA GLOBAL RESEARCH

Our price objective of ZAR250/share (ADR US\(13.95) is set at c. 1.35x Price to NPV multiple (P/DCF using a WACC of 5%). Through the cycle, HAR shares trade on average P/NPV of 1.3x. In an upward trending gold price environment, more operationally geared equities like HAR should outperform, in our view. Additionally, higher multiples tend to be paid during periods of rising precious metals prices. We have a positive view on gold, where our metals strategists think that gold can reach\)4,000/oz in 2H25. However, HAR's gold hedges, declining production and growth execution risks weigh on upside during this high gold price environment.

The upside risks to our price objective are as follows: i) Additional production/value being realised from Mponeng and Moab Khotsong than we currently model. ii) Value realisation through sale of the Golpu project in Papua New Guinea (not our base case). iii) Higher- than- expected gold and copper prices. iv) Weaker- than- expected ZAR. v) Lower- than- expected cost inflation.

The downside risks to our price objective are i) higher- than- expected cost inflation in South Africa, predominantly from wages and electricity, ii) stronger- than- expected ZAR, iii) lower- than- expected gold prices, iv) labour unrest, v) production negatively impacted by a shortage of electricity in South Africa.
EMEA - Metals & Mining, Steel, Paper Coverage Cluster

Qdatabase is our real-time global research database that is sourced directly from our equity analysts' earnings models and includes forecasted as well as historical data for income statements, balance sheets, and cash flow statements for companies covered by BofA Global Research.

FUNDAMENTAL EQUITY OPINION KEY: Opinions include a Volatility Risk Rating, an Investment Rating and an Income Rating. VOLATILITY RISK RATINGS, indicators of potential price fluctuation, are: A - Low, B - Medium and C - High. INVESTMENT RATINGS reflect the analyst's assessment of both a stock's absolute total return potential as well as its attractiveness for investment relative to other stocks within its Coverage Cluster (defined below). Our investment ratings are: 1 - Buy stocks are expected to have a total return of at least \(10\%\) and are the most attractive stocks in the coverage cluster; 2 - Neutral stocks are expected to remain flat or increase in value and are less attractive than Buy rated stocks and 3 - Underperform stocks are the least attractive stocks in a coverage cluster. An investment rating of 6 (No Rating) indicates that a stock is no longer trading on the basis of fundamentals. Analysts assign investment ratings considering, among other things, the 0-12 month total return expectation for a stock and the firm's guidelines for ratings dispersions (shown in the table below). The current price objective for a stock should be referenced to better understand the total return expectation at any given time. The price objective reflects the analyst's view of the potential price appreciation (depreciation).
Investment ratingTotal return expectation (within 12-month period of date of initial rating)Ratings dispersion guidelines for coverage clusterR2Buy≥ 10%≤ 70%Neutral≥ 0%≤ 30%UnderperformN/A≥ 20%

R2Ratings dispersions may vary from time to time where BofA Global Research believes it better reflects the investment prospects of stocks in a Coverage Cluster. INCOME RATINGS, indicators of potential cash dividends, are: 7 - same/higher (dividend considered to be secure), 8 - same/lower (dividend not considered to be secure) and 9 - pays no cash dividend. Coverage Cluster is comprised of stocks covered by a single analyst or two or more analysts sharing a common industry, sector, region or other classification(s). A stock's coverage cluster is included in the most recent BofA Global Research report referencing the stock.
